data.title: Oldest and youngest players and goal
data.text:
Oldest and Youngest Players and Goal-scorers in International Football

There follow lists of the oldest and youngest players and goal-scorers in international football history (matches between national teams), based on information known to the authors at the time of writing. There are also lists of the oldest débutants, and the players with the longest "career" span (between first and last appearances).

These lists are very likely to be incomplete, particularly the women's lists, due to the lamentable unavailability of sufficiently detailed and accurate historical information for many countries.

Additions or corrections are welcomed by the authors (nfm24(AT)cantab.net) - any potential additional cases should preferably be evidenced. Any player who would rather not have his/her birth date published here is advised to contact the authors.

Rolls probably holds the all-time women's record for the longest wait between successive caps. When she played on 1-Mar-2012 (0-0 vs South Africa), it was her first international match since 7-Nov-1996 (1-1 vs Papua New Guinea). In the intervening 15-year hiatus she played over 100 cricket matches for her country, winning the World Cup in 2000. Unconfirmed last appearance: Svetlana Novikova Belarus 40-41y 20-Oct-1970 2008-2012 [5] [ 5]. Novikova was a member of the national squad in 2012, but it is unclear when she last played in an official match.
